column1: '''''Cirion and Eorl and the Friendship of Gondor and Rohan''''' is a chapter in the book ''[[Unfinished Tales]]''
column2: written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and published posthumously by his son

column1: The chapter explores the friendship between [[Gondor]] and [[Rohan]]. [[Cirion]] worried about the [[Balchoth]] threat
column2: sends [[Borondir|Borondir Udalraph]] to seek help from the [[Éothéod]]. Borondir meets [[Eorl]] and presents him the [[Red Arrow]]; their band eventually come to the [[Battle of the Field of Celebrant]].

column1: We see then the oath of Cirion about the alliance of the two people over the [[Tomb of Elendil]]
column2: the gifting of [[Calenardhon]] to the Éothéod for their new home as [[Rohan]]. Then there is a discussion about the [[Tradition of Isildur]] concerning the Tomb of Elendil.

column1: The text is part of another essay of Tolkien
column2: "[[The Rivers and Beacon-hills of Gondor]]" which was published in [[Vinyar Tengwar 42|''Vinyar Tengwar''
